title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.10.24| 11-06-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyanati Miran Dhasya Gyanan Janishalakaya
Chakshurun Meelitam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnu Padaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale
Shri Mate Bhakti Vedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatya Deshatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda
Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shiva Sadhi Gaurabhakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama
Hare Hare Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya
Narayanam Namaskritya Naram Chaiva Narottamam
Deveem Saraswateem Vyasam Tato Jayamudhi Rayet
In this session we will be discussing from the 24th verse of the 10th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
Savaayam Sakhi Anugeeta Sakkatho
Vedeshu Guhyejucha
Guhyavadibhihi
Ya Eka Eesho Jagad Atma Leelaya
Srijati Avati Atti Natatra Sajjate
The meaning of this verse is
O dear friends, here is that very personality of Godhead
whose attractive and confidential pastimes
are described in the confidential parts of Vedic literature by his great devotees.
It is he only who...
Who creates, maintains and annihilates the material world
and yet remains unaffected.
These are words spoken by the ladies of Ashthinapura.
They know the transcendental nature of Krishna's personality.
They are not mistaking him to be another ordinary King.
Even though he is playing the role of the King,
Even though he is playing the role of the King,
Even though he is playing the role of the King,
of Dwaraka it is actually his eternal Leela in the spiritual world which he is
displaying in the material world to attract us the conditioned souls who are
trapped here he wants us to get out of this material existence put an end to
all our suffering that's Krishna's mission and that's the mission of all
Krishna's devotees also so it is Krishna only who is the supreme personality of
God it who creates maintains and unleads the material world and he remains
unaffected that cannot be said of the Devatas or anybody else who is engaged
in different activities in this material world
you
can see that in the material world everyone else becomes bound up by their
material actions whereas Krishna remains completely transcendental under all
circumstances and here it's also said that Krishna's pastimes are confidential
confidential parts of the Vedic literature by his great devotees so
ordinarily the Vedas described the absolute truth in terms of the impersonal
feature and the localized feature the Brahman feature and the Paramahatma
feature the descriptions of the
the Bhagawan feature the personal feature is very rarely found in the
original Vedas it is there in the original Vedas but it is not so much
described the bulk of the Vedas consists of the descriptions of the interactions
to the three gunas trai guna vishaya Veda and the conclusion of the Vedas
given as Vedanta philosophy describes mostly the impersonal feature or the
Brahman feature of the absolute truth so if you really want to hear the most
attractive personal feature of the absolute truth
Krishnamurti
Krishna Rama Narsimha Brahma Narayana all of these activities of the
personality of Godhead in his various incarnations and especially his
activities in his form original form as Krishna then you have to hear the most
confidential part of the Vedic literature which describes those
confidentialities of the Vedas and the personal features of the Vedas
confidential pastimes and they are described only by great devotees they
discard only by great devotees
so in the purport from the process as stated in the Bhagavad Gita all the

completely

he looks like a limited person but he is unlimited personality he looks like he
